thank.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to tell someone that you are pleased and grateful for something they have done, or to be polite about it
thank.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: I haven’t had a chance to thank him yet.
Did you thank Uncle Ron for the present?
thank.translation[0].note_box[0].section: thank
to tell someone that you are pleased and grateful for something they have given you or done for you
She thanked them for the presents.
You don’t need to thank me.
He thanked her for coming and showed her to her car.
say thank you
to thank someone by saying the words ‘thank you’, or by giving them something
I just wanted to say thank you for all your help.
This gift is our way of saying thank you to everyone who worked so hard.
Make sure you say thank you for your birthday presents.
express your gratitude
to thank someone for something they have done – used in speeches and letters
I would like to express my gratitude to all those who have sent me letters of support.
show your appreciation
to thank someone by giving them something, or by doing something special for them
To show our gratitude for all your hard work, we are paying you a special bonus.
acknowledge
to publicly do or say something to thank someone for their help or support
The building will be named the John Laird Centre, to acknowledge the contribution of the Laird family to the area.
He acknowledged the applause with a small bow.
